description: Mary seated on a cloud accompanied by many cherubs; cherubs in sky in ULC and drawing back a cloth in URC; angel at left with scales pulling up a woman while two men and other figures look on from bottom; sketchy style
medium: Pen and black ink, gray, yellow and brown wash, with white heightening, on laid paper
provenance: Cavaliere G. C. Rossi, Lugt 2212 (19th century), Rome. I. O. Wessner, Lugt 2562a (1851-1921), Saint-Gall, Switzerland. Sale, Christie's, July 3, 1990, no. 38, as Neapolitan School, 18th century, for Â£3,345, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1990-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Madonna Rescuing Souls from Purgatory
